<p>If your laptop simply isn’t cutting it anymore, <a data-i13n="cpos:1;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/deals/the-best-amazon-prime-day-deals-for-the-last-day-our-top-picks-on-headphones-tvs-robot-vacuums-and-more-120028336.html">Amazon Prime Day</a> might have arrived just in time. As has been the case for the past few years, laptop deals are abundant this Prime Day, bringing discounts to MacBooks, Windows laptops, Chromebooks and more. But we wouldn’t blame you if you didn’t know how to figure out if that laptop you’re eyeing actually has a good discount for Prime Day, or if the deal is stale.</p> 
<p>That’s where Engadget can help. We’ve poured over the Prime Day laptop deals available this year to pick out the best ones you can get across all kinds of computers. If you’re super picky about the specs you want in a new laptop, we always recommend going straight to the manufacturer so you can configure the machine exactly to your needs. But if you’re willing to work with premade models, Prime Day deals could help you save some cash on your next laptop. Just be sure to make your selection quickly, because we expect most of these deals to end tonight when Prime Day is officially over.</p> <span id="end-legacy-contents"></span>
<h2 id="jump-link-prime-day-laptop-deals-macbooks">Prime Day laptop deals: MacBooks</h2> 
<p>Apple’s latest laptops are the MacBook Air M4 and the MacBook Pro M4, but the M3-powered machines are still available and great values when you can get them at steep discounts. But for the most future-proof options, we recommend going with the M4 MacBooks. Amazon actually has decent MacBook deals throughout the year, most of the time on the base configurations of any given model. In a welcomed update, Apple recently made all base models of the MacBook Air M4 have 16GB of RAM by default (which is the same as you’ll find on the base-level Pros).</p> 
<p>

<h2 id="jump-link-prime-day-laptop-deals-windows-laptops">Prime day laptop deals: Windows laptops</h2> 
<p>You’ve got a lot of variety to choose from when it comes to Windows laptops, and that can be a blessing or a curse. We recommend looking for a laptop from a reputable brand (i.e. Microsoft, Dell, Acer, Lenovo and others like them), and one that can handle daily work or play pressures. That means at least 8GB of RAM and 245GB of SSD storage, plus the latest Intel or AMD CPUs. If you’re looking for a new gaming laptop, you’ll need a bit more power and a dedicated graphics card to boot. Now is a good time to consider upgrading as well since Windows 10 will be sunset in October this year and <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Microsoft;elmt:;cpos:5;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=67071605-d4df-494e-8d9c-c9c236b8bb38&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=a3e8fc7d-d1ed-4d0c-be65-2a9a6472a02e&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Microsoft&amp;linkText=Microsoft+has+recommended&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5taWNyb3NvZnQuY29tL2VuLXVzL3dpbmRvd3MvZW5kLW9mLXN1cHBvcnQ_cj0xIiwiY29udGVudFV1aWQiOiJhM2U4ZmM3ZC1kMWVkLTRkMGMtYmU2NS0yYTlhNjQ3MmEwMmUiLCJvcmlnaW5hbFVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lm1pY3Jvc29mdC5jb20vZW4tdXMvd2luZG93cy9lbmQtb2Ytc3VwcG9ydD9yPTEifQ&amp;signature=AQAAAaL6x7jj6-2QyIGdihwrpcGtG37n9NHdZ66bEREAVUdq&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fwindows%2Fend-of-support%3Fr%3D1" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/end-of-support?r=1">Microsoft has recommended</a> users upgrade to newer Windows 11 laptops.</p>

<h2 id="jump-link-prime-day-laptop-deals-chromebooks">Prime Day laptop deals: Chromebooks</h2> 
<p>Most Chromebooks start off pretty affordable, so that just means you can get them for even less during an event like Prime Day. If you’re a Chrome OS lover, it’s also a decent time to check out sales on premium Chromebooks, which can usually cost $500 or more. In general, we recommend looking for at least 4 to 8GB of RAM and at least 128GB of SDD storage in a Chromebook that you plan on using as your daily driver.</p> 
<p>
